programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Tasked with shadowing a crisis prevention team, Upton finds her approach to policing at odds with the team's mental health clinician; Voight stands by Upton as she continues to struggle in her personal life.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek gets mixed up in a case after a late-night poker game is raided; afraid of becoming like his father, Ruzek struggles to stand down and allow Intelligence to carry out the investigation while he remains on leave.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Bunny comes to Lindsay with a concern that leads the team to a case that robbery-homicide has been investigating; Voight is suspicious of Bunny's motives.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess and Roman become trapped after Burgess pursues suspicious activity at a convenience store without calling in for backup; the intelligence team receives taser certification.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When an undercover narcotics officer goes missing, Antonio is asked to help find him; Burgess and Roman ask Mouch (Christian Stolte) for help with a squatter situation.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The members of intelligence go under cover at a World Trade conference to assess political threats; Halstead's brother immediately stirs up trouble when he shows up in town.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman who's cheating on her husband with a young lover is being blackmailed. She hires Nick to help her, but it might be too late to prevent a tragedy.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: When Nick's old P.I. colleague is found dead, he gets the dead colleague's strange case that involves a wealthy property developer.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman hires Nick to find his missing wife. The man's colleagues may know something about her disappearance.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An eyewitness falls for Nick when he stops an armed robbery at a store. She decides to help him identify the robber she saw fleeing from the store. There's just one problem - she might be seeing things.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The 6th Duke of Stowbridge accidentally murders his lover. No one knows about it except his wife who, fearing for her own safety, asks Nick for help.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Experiments include mixing diet cola with mints, pulling an egg into a flash, and carbonating pickle juice.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Newton's 3rd law: 'For every action there's an equal and opposite reaction'. To prove it works no matter how big or small something is, Phil maxes it out by building an air pressure powered rocket car that he can ride.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Creatures from the continent of South America; a jaguar's jaws' ability to crush bone; the growth of a Galapagos tortoise.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the natural beauty of the Canadian Rockies. Philippe canoes on the famous, glacier-fed Lake Louise at Banff National Park. We hike up a glacier at Jasper National Park and discover much more.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. Later, a trip to NASA.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett asks Catherine to help find his mother; the teams seek assistance from August March (Edward Asner) with a deadly art heist.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett's day at sea takes a deadly turn when their boat is hijacked.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett's mom pays him an unexpected visit while the team investigates a polo player's death.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: As the team investigates a grisly murder, evidence suggests the killer is about to strike again.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny must hold completely still as technicians disarm a bomb he accidentally activated; McGarrett tries to distract his partner by sharing a story about a tough case.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The murder of a computer hacker prompts an investigation, and McGarrett tries to stage a reunion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett thinks a smart, seductive therapist (Vanessa Marcil) murdered one of her patients; one of Doris' former targets seeks revenge.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A botched robbery puts Max and his crush (Rumer Willis) in danger; when a stalker targets a supermodel, Danny must come to her rescue.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and a little girl are taken hostage by an armed man (Tom Arnold) during a camping trip with Grace; Kono meets Adam's brother, who was recently released from prison.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When an Army Ranger goes missing after returning from deployment, Magnum learns of the traumatic news he received upon arriving home and must find him before survivor's guilt consumes him.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When a married woman asks Magnum and Higgins to find her lover's killer because she doesn't want to expose the affair to the police, they find the victim wasn't who he claimed to be; Rick visits Icepick, whose health has taken a turn for the worse.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When a Marine Corps vet's SUV is stolen with her service dog inside, Magnum and Higgins must find the car, the dog and the car thief who they believe may be an escaped kidnapping victim.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: As Magnum and Higgins work a case to recover valuable stolen truffles, they also must care for a baby left abandoned at the gates of their estate; Kumu tries to locate the infant's mother.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A psychic hires Magnum and Higgins to prevent a murder she claims to have foreseen; Katsumoto questions Kumu when her information is found on recovered stolen jewels that once belonged to the infamous Imelda Marcos.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum's uncle visits and reveals a shocking secret about Thomas' mother; TC asks Higgins for help when he realizes he may have witnessed a potential murder from his helicopter; Higgins decides it's time to tell Ethan the truth about her past.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins work a stalking case involving a man with a past in espionage; Ethan asks Higgins to join him on an extended trip for Doctors Without Borders just as Magnum starts to open up to other possibilities.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick is hired to find a woman who got hold of a new deadly drug. As his search progresses, Nick begins to wonder if he was actually hired to find the drug itself.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A nurse has been murdered, the Doctor who worked with her may be the perpetrator. Nick is on the case, but someone is one step ahead of him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Spider gets involved with an unstable bounty hunter couple.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie are hired to protect a food critic whose life may be in serious danger. Unfortunately, they fail. Then a psychic shows up claiming to have seen more deaths that are in connection with this case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan makes a shocking discovery while trying to identify a Jane Doe; Brennan tries to come to grips with her parents' past.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the site of a train wreck that includes the bodies of a senator and a high-profile businessman.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Wrapped in a shroud, the body of a young man lies beside an overturned garbage truck; Brennan's past as a foster child influences her judgment; Brennan and Cam butt heads over their work styles; Cam makes threats.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The squad makes a quick arrest when a student is raped at gunpoint in her apartment, but the defense attorney works to undermine their police work.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a young mail-order bride is found dead, the investigation leads the detectives to the Russian mafia.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a stock supercharged CTS-V and converts it to twin turbos; they put an intake manifold where the supercharger was, and then put in a new exhaust that includes turbos.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road; the crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then overhauls the fuel delivery system to get this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in Faye's 1980 VW Rabbit for some fabrication.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls have to figure out why an '87 C10 isn't running anymore; they know it's a fuel problem that happened after an EFI setup was installed; they finish up with a new disc-brake kit; Bogi takes a field trip to show how custom fuel lines are made.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how to rebuild and upgrade an R154 manual transmission so it will last as long as the Toyota engine; they also drop a valve body on an automatic transmission, drilling it out and adding stronger sleeves to keep it lasting longer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take an old AMC Spirit drag car and get it ready for the street by changing out the oversized carb. They bring in a special guest to help them pick out the right carb and tune it on the car.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A GTO that has spent a lot of its life in shops with mechanics who had no intention of finishing it, is brought in by its owner for some final touches, including checking gauges, air conditioning and the steering column.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye find a 1972 Challenger at a customer's house, and when they learned how it was a triple black, they discuss restoring it to original; the work starts with rebuilding the numbers-matching 340.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out which cheap carburetors produce the most expensive results; they pick a fight among remanufactured offerings from Edelbrock, Summit and Demon to see which will pump the most power into their 383 Chevrolet.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys experiment with lash adjustments in an effort unleash more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether a dual or a single exhaust system has more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys answer the question of whether a carb spacer produces more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys do a 4/7 swap on a big 572 to see if there's more power to be had.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys compare four of the most popular intake manifolds on the market.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys take 555 BBC and the Blower Shop then test the difference in power between gas and e85.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys dive into the lobe separation angle of the camshaft.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore the gains to be found for a sickly, low-compression 440.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys go through the basics of bringing a motor to the dyno cell.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew asks whether it's worth it to upgrade an ignition system.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore how header collector length affects power output.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys follow Freiburger's personal quest for 1,000 NA horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew investigates just how much power gets sacrificed to look cool.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if lightweight rotating assembly parts help make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test three sets of headers on a power-boosted motor.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether tunnel-ram or cross-ram setups make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see which muffler works best for street-driving 1,000 HP monsters.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys break down two very different engines that make similar numbers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich puts his Leaning Tower of Power to the test.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test blower cams with their new 363ci small-block Ford.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: After years of dismissal, the guys give the Gen III Hemi a fair shake.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Carb whisperer Steve Brule has tips to get a Holley 4150 running its best.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Dulcich tests four aftermarket intake manifolds on his 225ci slant six.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test which type of cylinder head delivers more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We're battling the two most recent iterations of the 5.7 III Hemi.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The Windsor family finally gets its turn at an intake shootout!

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys debate if a solid roller camshaft is worth the extra money.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We run our LS with factory exhaust manifolds and again with turbo headers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys deliberately heat and cool fuel to see the difference it makes.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out if Max Wedge heads are really a worthwhile upgrade.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We find out whether header wraps really do create more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test out a bunch of Holley's "Ram" intakes on their 6.2-liter LS.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We test six manifolds with our old-school carb and our new-school 6.0 LS.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if exhaust cutouts do more than rattle passersby's eardrums.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew super-tunes every HP out of the 410 Windsor from the Disgustang.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test out three low-buck cylinder heads on a 383 small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test how different carb features affect horsepower and tunability.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys challenge their previous findings testing single-pattern cams.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if too much oil pressure robs precious horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to boost an 800-horspower 572 up to a comfortable 950+.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys shoot out six packs on a 440 to see which makes the most power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys figure out how to make more power with a flex fuel engine.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see whether boost and vacuum leaks actually affect power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see how wet and dry nitrous systems stack up on an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Multipoint EFI gets its turn against the venerable Dominator.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A supercharged medium-sized mill takes on a naturally aspirated big block.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew pits a four-barrel carb against dual quads on the tunnel ram.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on a pair of Grand Nationals from the 1980s.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou dial up a Ferrari F430, giving it a whole new look and sound.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on a Camaro IROC-Z with an original 305 engine.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou add an upgraded turbo kit to a Ford Mustang EcoBoost.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou add 120 horsepower to a Camaro Z28 with a supercharger kit.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou do some custom fabrication on Rickey Gadson's motorcycle.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou turn a Mercedes-Benz E550 into a Black Series E-Class AMG.

programme.desc: Jared and Lou do a Hemi swap on a Dodge to take a 5.7L engine to a 6.4L.

programme.title: Car Fix

programme.desc: The guys find out the hard way what happens when they put a 6.2 liter supercharged Hellcrate engine in a '73 Challenger; when the factory rear end blows up, they swap it out for an upgrade with the right gear setup.

programme.title: Car Fix

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New England Patriots had rookie QB Drake Maye back after being knocked out of last week's win over the Jets and used his legs, running for a career-best and team-high 95 yards. The Pats had a final chance after Maye forced overtime with a 5-yard TD pass to Rhamondre Stevenson, but Amani Hooker's second interception of the game clinched the victory for the Titans with 2:07 left.

programme.title: Game of the Week
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes leads the Kansas City Chiefs over Baker Mayfield and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers with 3 touchdowns, 2 of which went to newest Chief, wide receiver DeAndre Hopkins, in an overtime thriller.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Buffalo Bills head coach Sean McDermott trusted kicker Tyler Bass for a 61-yard field goal with 5 seconds left, sealing a 30-27 win over Miami. In a thrilling duel, Buffalo's Josh Allen threw three second-half touchdowns, and both teams traded leads four times with seven straight scoring drives.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive the final game of Hall of Fame linebacker Ray Lewis' legendary career, as he and quarterback Joe Flacco guided the Baltimore Ravens to a thrilling win over the San Francisco 49ers in Super Bowl XLVII.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New England Patriots had rookie QB Drake Maye back after being knocked out of last week's win over the Jets and used his legs, running for a career-best and team-high 95 yards. The Pats had a final chance after Maye forced overtime with a 5-yard TD pass to Rhamondre Stevenson, but Amani Hooker's second interception of the game clinched the victory for the Titans with 2:07 left.

programme.title: Game of the Week
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes leads the Kansas City Chiefs over Baker Mayfield and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers with 3 touchdowns, 2 of which went to newest Chief, wide receiver DeAndre Hopkins, in an overtime thriller.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Buffalo Bills head coach Sean McDermott trusted kicker Tyler Bass for a 61-yard field goal with 5 seconds left, sealing a 30-27 win over Miami. In a thrilling duel, Buffalo's Josh Allen threw three second-half touchdowns, and both teams traded leads four times with seven straight scoring drives.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.desc: The Story of a horse and the boy who loved him! In this thrilling Western TV series a recent widower (Peter Graves) and owner of the Broken Wheel ranch takes in Joey, a young orphan boy. Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

To make matters worse, Yancy's name has been used to purchase the dynamite for their diabolical plan.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer

programme.title: Bonanza

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The son of a neighboring rancher wants to sell land off for mining, violating a water rights agreement that Ben made with his father years ago.

programme.title: Bonanza

Clay and Steve unexpectedly cross paths with a group of dance hall girls -- including Mary (Gloria Grahame), Marcia (Martha Hyer) and Helen (Myrna Dell) -- whose stagecoach has broken down, and help them get to the nearest ranch, where Lednov unfortunately catches up to Clay.

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A young man is mistaken for a notorious outlaw and has a hard time convincing Diablo's townspeople that he didn't commit a stagecoach robbery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers – PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION – facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.desc: The 22 remaining junior home cooks are divided into teams of four and face a speed and teamwork challenge to make as many perfect banana splits as possible! Not only is an elimination on the line, but the winning team gets to turn a judge into a human banana split.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s first big team challenge, the top 20 junior home cooks test their leadership and communication skills in a bold carnival-themed competition. As two teams of nine fuel 51 Circus Vargas performers with a delicious lunch, one team prepares seared salmon and the other grills NY strip steak. With at least two contestants on the chopping block, the home cooks must rise to the occasion in a birthday cake pressure challenge to prove their rightful spot.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tries to improve a Pittsburgh eatery plagued by negative customer feedback and a squabbling staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay stops by Barefoot Bob's, a beachfront restaurant in Massachusetts that's owned by a couple whose marriage is fraying.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the remaining 18 young home cooks, who must debone an entire fish and make a MASTERCHEF worthy dish, or be at risk in a challenge. Not only are there big stakes at hand – the winner will receive a special advantage worthy of the effort – but the cooks also bring heart to the table as they reveal how their cultural heritages influence their cooking styles.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 16 home cooks face a sticky situation when they are divided into three teams and tasked with a Gordon masterclass – make as many stunning English trifles as possible in under 20 minutes. Only one team proves they have enough creativity and finesse to bypass the elimination round, the remaining home cooks are challenged to make three identical sliders.

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay checks on the status of Cafe Hon, Chiarella's and Leone's to see if they heeded his advice.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the plantation on Crystal River to fish with Dallas King For trout and redfish.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: On this trip, Mark finds himself in Eastern Colorado looking for a big mature Mule Deer. Eastern Colorado is known for some of the best spot and stalk Mule Deer hunting in the US. With the rut in full swing, seeing bucks isn't usually a problem. But getting in range of a big mature buck can be a challenge. Mark spots the mature deer he wants to pursue and spends all of his time trying to get.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson’s Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a very unique hunt where Mark has an Alberta Ministers tag which means 100% of the revenue from this tag goes back to the province of Alberta to fund conservation program studies for Elk, Bighorn Sheep and Mule deer. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest for the New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. It’s the Monday after opening weekend and Mark will be set up in a stubble field. The majority of the birds running through this area are Mallards, Geese, Black Ducks, and Paradise Ducks. With the weather in their favor, it’s up to Mark and his Benelli shotgun to do the rest.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Veracruz, Mexico chasing after a free-range Axis Deer. With warmer temps still presenting challenges, Mark and his guide head to a Michon overlooking a pond full of crocodiles. With the temps getting as warm as 90 degrees, the Axis deer search for water to stay hydrated. With time running out on the final day, they catch movement in the brush and a beautiful Axis buck steps out to take a drink.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Florida and looking for gator number two. After being successful on the morning hunt with his Gunwerks, Mark adds the AMS big game bowfishing kit to his Mathews and heads back out to the swamps in search of his first gator with a bow. It took a few shots to get dialed in, but he eventually connected with gator number two on this trip to the sunshine state.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark heads to Queensland, Australia in search of a unique species, Hog Deer. Hog Deer have a typical appearance for species of the genus Axis. However, they differ from axis deer by their sturdy build and short-faced appearance. On day one of their hunt, Mark lays eyes on his first Hog Deer. During their pursuit, a really good Blackbuck appears over the horizon. They quickly make a move and Mark puts down an awesome Blackbuck. The day is still young and the team decides to hit one more spot for a Hog Deer. Once they put eyes on a bedded buck, they close the distance and it's a waiting game.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark and his dogs travel West to Nebraska to hunt free range Pheasants with his dad Earl. Mark and Earl are hosted by Worldwide Trophy Adventures CEO Ryan Watchorn. The group spends two days getting after a limit of pheasants while also getting Ryan’s son his first bird.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father Earl, are hunting the smaller Hawaiian island of Moloka'i. The island is 260 square miles with a population of 7,404 but is a sportsman's paradise. They are after Grey and Black Francolin. Follow along as Mark and Earl pursue the Grey and Black Francolin species from their list.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. There’s no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's time in Argentina is winding down and he needs just one more species before moving on to Peru: the Brazilian Teal. The guides have seen a few in the area so Mark and his crew try some new tactics, hoping to close in on the 13th and final species on this leg of the journey.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew gets one more hunt in before the rain arrives in Georgia. Michael Pitts finally has the right wind to head back into the honey hole. Colton Jordan hunts with his father Bill hoping to lay eyes on a buck they spotted earlier in the year. Tyler Jordan decides to hang and hunt a new spot where a big 9-pointer is showing up.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: 9/3/23: Day 3 in Nebraska and despite the extreme heat the bucks are on their feet. Michael Pitts, Ben McDonald and Bryan Brown hit the woods hoping to fill their opening week tags.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan's road trip continues in Illinois. The guys head to the legendary Grigsby Farm. After multiple encounters with a big deer, Jordan is finally able to put a great buck on the ground

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew travels to Louisiana to hunt with the Realtree waterfowl pro staff. This episode features Rusty Creasey, manager of the famed Coco Cola woods in Arkansas. Rusty takes a day off during the split to hunt with Realtree’s Stephen McNelly and Cole Barthel. Be sure to subscribe and follow along as we feature duck hunting Legends like Jim Ronquest, Si Roberston, Dr. Duck, Justin Martin, and more.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The crew needed a weather change to get the bucks on their feet before shooting light ended in Nebraska. They got their wish. Highs in the 100's changed to highs in the 60's and sustained 30 MPH winds! Check out Pitts' 5th day hunt for the target buck he's been after all week!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: : Colder temps in the South bring two things: ducks and duck hunters. Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are back in public timber, but so is the public. Will they get the hole? Will birds flare from sky busters? Find out on this week's episode.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell make adjustments in the dry fields to make it happen on Northern Honkers. This is a dry-field goose hunt you don't want to miss. It's full of action.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: After coaxing in bulls for Troy, Brad, and Jordan, it’s time for Will Primos to go front and center. With Jordan calling the shots, you won’t believe the opportunity Wilbur has when this New Mexico monster makes his presence known!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: This week Ol’ Jimbo digs deep and gives it everything he has in the hopes of getting his first bull with a bow. It’s all about lessons learned, anxious encounters, and some HUGE bull action to be remembered for a lifetime with a Team Primos legend.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: After 23 years of patiently waiting for an Arizona elk tag, Brad finds himself in one of the most unique elk hunt situations he’s ever experienced. Are his decades of experience going to be enough to bag a bull on public lands in the Grand Canyon State?

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos leaves their legendary locale and head to higher ground. After 6 years of exciting hunts up and down the Mississippi River, the guys relive their best moments at Cottonmouth as they pack up to journey to Kudzu Bluff, their new home east of the Mississippi.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s early December as Team Primos preps for the Mississippi rut at our new camp, Kudzu Bluff. Faced with the pandemic and several other obstacles, our early season flew right by. After all the preparation and scouting, who’s gonna bag the first buck of the Bluffs?

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Brad and Jordan head west to our good friend Jerry Paige’s Kansas farm for an early November rut bow hunt. We’re breakin’ out the Rattling Horns, The Can, the Buck Roar, and every trick we know of to call in a couple of Sunflower State giants.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton makes a trip to South Carolina to fish Lake Murray. He meets up with the Rather Outdoors crew to spend time on the water and at the Rather HQ checking out all the gear from Lews and Strike King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew is chasing Tarpon in Tampa Florida with Ryan Harrington. After a few close calls and grinding out the long days, they finally catch up to the Silver King.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While they’re there, Trenton spends a day with “Mr. Worldwide” James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve head west from Key West to battle with big kingfish and end up with plenty of meat for the smoker.

programme.title: Into the Blue

programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed André 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"—though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real André announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he’s not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: The highs and lows of fishing teach us to ride the wave, and the captains, mates, and everyday Costa Rican citizens have a phrase for such a mindset – “Pura Vida.” Those two words are more of a cultural ethos than a casual expression, and a reminder to remain smiling, thankful, and to never sweat the small stuff.For the crews and anglers of Los Sueños, the good days far outweigh the bad. Nestled inside a small nook of Playa Herradura, Costa Rica’s Los Sueños Resort and Marina serves as a luxury embarkation point for some of the world’s most heralded bluewater fishing. Many places tout similar claims, but numbers don’t lie: It is common for a single boat to release over a dozen marlin in a single day, and the area holds perhaps the largest concentrations of big Pacific sailfish anywhere.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: It's turkey time and The Bearded Buck crew is going on a tour! Starting in Florida, Jerry and Austin are hunting Osceolas with Jeff Budz. From there, Jerry and Cud are headed out to hunt with our good friend, Ron Kendra, in his home state of Virginia. To finish things off, Jerry is meeting up with good friends, David "Bunch" Hale and Dan Thurston, in Kansas.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair fishes the South Texas flats using artificial lures with Capt. Luis Flandes.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: We explore the sophisticated world of the whitetail deer's senses, exploring how these remarkable creatures have evolved to pattern hunters through their keen sense of smell and heightened sensory awareness.

programme.title: Their Life My Lens
programme.desc: Bryce and Chasten go inshore fishing and try to get Bryce on his first ever redfish.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: The Deep South State Swamp Donkey action continues with Part 2! After a close encounter with a big buck in Part 1, Brad returns to Swamp Donkey Properties for a late season hunt. In twist of fate, that same buck returns for a second round.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike has been looking forward to raising his sons to respect and enjoy the outdoors since they day they were born. This was finally the year Kamden was going to be behind the bow

programme.title: Behind the Draw

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors

programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head to Texas for their annual hunt with the Nature’s Eye crew.

programme.desc: Zach Wentz chases a once-in-a-lifetime buck named Freak.

programme.desc: The word is out! The Southern California Bluefin Tuna fishing is on fire and the waters of San Diego are literally Foaming with Life. Ali and Rush switch their targets from the jumbo size Bluefin Tuna to a smaller, medium grade fish for non-stop run and gun action. But, with so many fish fixated on the masses of bait in the area, it may take a million casts to pull one out of the froth.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Possibly more rewarding then an invite to experience a new fishery is one's ability to return the favor. For Ali and Rush, sharing their home waters with others is one of the best parts of the job. While Rush takes SoCal friends Brandon and Eric Nelson fishing in Key West for Permit, Ali rounds up a familiar Florida Everglades native for some San Diego Bluefin Tuna fishing.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters’ Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After wrestling with some massive bull sharks, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and guest Captain Garrett Stephens encounter some crazy cobia action and it takes all their strength and skill to keep them away from the sharks.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of Team Winchester shooters Zach Kienbaum and Desirae Edmunds is told. Zach and Desi discuss how they got started in the shooting sports and how important coaching has become to both of them. They also talk shooting tips. Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team.
